definition: to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: The boss docked $50 from his wages.
sentences.chinese: 老板从他的工资中扣去50美元。

sentences.english: The boss kept back 100 dollars from his salary for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 老板无端地从他的薪水中扣去了100美元。

sentences.english: The boss docked the worker's pay 10 dollars.
sentences.chinese: 老板从那工人的工资中扣去10美元。

sentences.english: For every mistake you make, you'll lose half a mark.
sentences.chinese: 你每犯一个错误，就要扣去半分。
老板从他的工资中扣去20美元。
老板从她的工资中扣去30美元。

sentences.english: After all expenses and dividend, this is the final net figure.
sentences.chinese: 扣去了所有的费用和股息，它就是最终的净值。

sentences.english: You can deduct the twenty-five cents out of my allowance.
sentences.chinese: 你可在我的零用钱里扣去二角五分钱。

definition: to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to pay in advance/to get payment in advance
